channel.title: Choreographic Coding Online on CCOnline
channel.description: Recent content in Choreographic Coding Online on CCOnline

item.title: 2020 08 06 Best Practices
item.description: 30 minutes of Naoto’s solo on blue background, followed by an improvisational Facebook-messenger call of Naoto in Cologne and Jorge and Matthjis at Performing Arts Forum.

item.title: 2020 08 05 Best Practices (Hydra Workshop)
item.description: Naoto in Cologne gave an informal Hydra workshop for Jorge and Matthijs at Performing Arts Forum.

item.title: Best Practices in Contemporary Dance
item.description: I started “Best Practices in Contemporary Dance” sessions with Jorge Guevara, based on an idea that emerged from the weekly “Choreographic Coding Online (CCOnline)” session.

item.title: 2020 07 30 Best Practices
item.description: An improvisational session on Facebook messenger, then on LiveLab between Naoto in Cologne and Jorge and Matthijs at Performing Arts Forum was recorded on July 30th.

item.title: 2020 07 23 Best Practices
item.description: Jorge and Matthijs in Performing Arts Forum joined Naoto in Cologne, after 10 minute of Naoto’s meditative session.

item.title: 2020 07 17 Best Practices
item.description: An improvisational session on LiveLab between Naoto in Cologne and Jorge and Matthijs at Performing Arts Forum was recorded on July 17th.

item.title: 2020 07 08 Best Practices
item.description: An improvisational session on LiveLab between Naoto in Cologne and Jorge and Matthijs at Performing Arts Forum was recorded on July 8th.

item.title: Algorithm | Degeneracy at NL_CL #2: Flesh
item.description: NL_CL #2: Flesh took place on May 24th, 2020 by Instrument Inventors Initiative (iii).

item.title: Dancing at Home
item.description: One of the things we cannot do since COVID-19 outbreak is to go to dance studios.

item.title: Articulation Hackathon
item.description: A multidisciplinary hackathon by the Articulations team took place on November 14th and 15th, 2019 at CNRS in Paris, France, after a two-day symposium at ENSAD.

item.title: HKAPA Residency
item.description: Video of Stäbetanze by Raphael Hillebrand, Naoto Hieda and HKAPA BFA students:

item.title: 11th Choreographic Coding Lab
item.description: The 11th Choreographic Coding Lab (CCL) organized by Motion Bank took place at Kunsthalle Mainz (Mainz, Germany) from April 28th to May 2nd, 2019.

item.title: NOVA: Choreographic Coding Lab + Pathfinder
item.description: The first edition of NOVA Festival was organized by Point theatre in Bucharest, Romania from April 20 to 29.

item.title: Body_Code
item.description: Naoto Hieda during a rehearsal. All photos in this article are by PERTE DE SIGNAL | Camille Montuelle

item.title: Studio 303 Residency
item.description: A practice with Nien Tzu Weng.

item.title: Piecemaker2 and Piecemeta 2
item.description: After writing the last article, I found a solution for the sync problems.

item.title: Piecemaker2 and Piecemeta 1
item.description: The project “Generative Pathways” is a collaboration between Naoto Hieda and Lisa Parra starting in September 2017.

item.title: EEG Experiments
item.description: How can digital media intervene communications between humans in a non-cognitive domain rather than simply being “intelligent” technologies?

item.title: CCL8: Choreographic Thinking Input
item.description: (text by Scott deLahunta) Motion Bank bases its dance digitisation - data recording, analysis, visualisation - on background research into the choreographer’s own tools and methods and then finding ways to integrate this understanding into various approaches to the data.

item.title: 12 dimensions of movement
item.description: A booklet by Quin Kennedy, who kindly gave permission to share the PDF.

item.title: CCL5: Choreographic Thinking Input
item.description: (text by Scott deLahunta) On Ros Warby’s website is a text titled ’process and philosophy’.

item.title: CCL4: Choreographic Thinking Input
item.description: (text by Scott deLahunta) During nearly 40 years of making dances, Deborah Hay has developed a unique way of accessing the choreographic thinking of her performers.

item.title: CCL4: Trackable Qualities
item.description: (compiled by CCL4 participants) Table of qualities Center of Mass
